member.name: M:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254x.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254x.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254xStatus.ConfigureServiceRequest(Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.AgilentU254xSRQReasonEnum)
member.summary: Clears all the enable registers. It then sets the appropriate transition filters and enable registers so when the specified event(s) occur(s) the instrument requests service. All other events are disabled from generating a service request. To detect a service request the client application must poll the status byte using the Status.SerialPoll method or Status.Register property and test the request service bit.
member.param: The defined values are powers of two, 1, 2, 4, etc. The client can OR several reasons together so multiple events can generate a service request.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254xSystem.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary:
The value, in milliseconds, of the default timeout used by I/O operations. This property provides access to the driver's Visa Session Timeout.

Only in rare, unusual circumstances should the client set this property. Driver methods and properties with operations which take a significant time to perform are responsible for adjusting the I/O timeout to an appropriate value. Some methods provide a MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter which gives the client direct control over the timeout value for that method. Sometimes, however, increasing the timeout value can work around an obscure driver defect.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254xAnalogInAcquisition
member.summary: AgilentU254x analog acquisition interface. Start() and Stop() hold the control to start or stop the acquisition. It also provide the property, Status and BuferStatus, to get the status of limit multiple scan acquisition and the buffer status for data capture of continuous multiple scan operation. The Read() and Fetch() provide the capability to read the acquired data from the DAQ. The TriggerMode let you set the trigger mode for acquisition.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254xAnalogInAcquisition.Fetch(System.Int16[]@)
member.summary: Retrieve the acquired data. This method will retrieve the data that are available at that moment and clear the retrieved data from the analog input buffer, then it return immediately; it do not wait for the completion of multiple scan operation.
member.param: Return an array for acquired data.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.IAgilentU254xAnalogInMultiScan
member.summary: AgilentU254x analog input multiple scan interface. This holds the configuration settings for multiple scan like sample rate, total count, and etc. There are two multiple scans acquisition mode, limit (also call one-shoot) and continuous, can be configure from the NumberOfScans property. Select the TriggerReaction and set CountDelay can change the beginning situation for multiple scans acquisition. The TimePerScan and TimePerPoint provide a quick referene for user calculation.

member.summary: Configure the multiple scan general settings.
member.param: The sample rate (scan rate) for the multiple scan operation.
The total number of scan process to be read in each multiple scan acquisition. Set to -1 for continuous multiple scan acquisition.

member.summary: Status Byte register. Conditions defined by IEEE 488.2.

member.summary: Standard Event Status register. Conditions defined by IEEE 488.2.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.AgilentU254xStatusSubRegisterEnum
member.summary: Enumeration for the SubRegister parameter of the Register property in the Status interface.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.AgilentU254xStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgilentU254xStatusSubRegisterCondition
member.summary: Conditions Register. Read only and not available with the Standard Event Status register. Condition bits represent the current instrument state. Reading a condition register does not change the value of the bits.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgilentU254x.Interop.AgilentU254xStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgilentU254xStatusSubRegisterEnable
member.summary: Enable Register. Can be read or written and is available for all registers. Enable bits select whether an event bit causes a register summary bit, a kind of condition bit, to become true. Thus, an event can propagated to the status byte and finally to request service. Though the bits in the status byte are not technically event bits, the status byte enable register selects which bits in the status byte cause a service request.
